alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 17 at 3:39PM HST until February 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR BIG ISLAND SUMMITS THROUGH 6 PM SATURDAY... .Deep moisture will continue stream over the area during the next couple of days, and with temperatures hovering near or below freezing over the highest elevations of the Big Island, a mix of heavy snow and freezing rain will persist through at least Saturday afternoon. Travel to the summits is extremely dangerous, with roads snow covered and icy. Additionally, gusty winds will produce widespread blowing and drifting snow, as well as near-zero visibility at times. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and freezing rain. Over a foot of additional snow expected along with significant icing. Winds gusting to around 50 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday, though hazardous winter weather may continue into Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel to the summits will be life-threatening and impossible, and the road to the Mauna Kea summit remains closed. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
